big.process1D.filter
Class OddSymmetricFIRFilter

java.lang.Object
  big.process1D.filter.OddSymmetricFIRFilter
All Implemented Interfaces:
FIRConvolver
public class OddSymmetricFIRFilter
extends java.lang.Object
implements FIRConvolver

This class encapsulates discrete-convolution operations on one-dimensional data with a filter that has an odd-symmetric impulse response.

Constructor Summary
OddSymmetricFIRFilter(double[] halfImpulseResponse)
          This constructor builds a convolver with the provided strictly causal part of the impulse response of the filter.

Constructor Detail

OddSymmetricFIRFilter

public OddSymmetricFIRFilter(double[] halfImpulseResponse)
This constructor builds a convolver with the provided strictly causal part of the impulse response of the filter. The filter data correspond to the strictly causal part of its impulse response. For example, if the impulse response of a filter with odd symmetry is {-0.25, -0.5, -1.0, 0.0, 1.0, 0.5, 0.25}, then its odd-symmetric form is {1.0, 0.5, 0.25}. (By convention, the value 0.0 at the origin does not belong to the strictly causal part of the filter.)

Parameters:
halfImpulseResponse - the provided strictly causal part of the impulse response of the filter.
Method Detail

getConvolution

public Data1D getConvolution(Data1D data)
Returns the result of the convolution between this filter and the argument data. The following combinations of size and boundary extensions are considered, with N = data.size() and K = halfImpulseResponse.length:
Extension (in)Size (in)Size (Filter)Size (out)Extension (out)
ANTIMIRRORS_BETWEEN_SAMPLESN2 K + 1NMIRRORS_BETWEEN_SAMPLES
ANTIMIRRORS_ON_SAMPLESN2 K + 1NMIRRORS_ON_SAMPLES
ANTISYMMETRICN2 K + 1NMIRRORS_ON_SAMPLES
MIRRORS_BETWEEN_SAMPLESN2 K + 1NANTIMIRRORS_BETWEEN_SAMPLES
MIRRORS_ON_SAMPLESN2 K + 1NANTIMIRRORS_ON_SAMPLES
PERIODICN2 K + 1NPERIODIC
SPREAD_EXTREMAL_VALUES12 K + 11ANTIMIRRORS_ON_SAMPLES
All other combinations result in an exception of type IllegalArgumentException.

Specified by:
getConvolution in interface FIRConvolver
Parameters:
data - the data to convolve.
Returns:
the result of the convolution.

inPlaceConvolve

public void inPlaceConvolve(Data1D data)
Performs the convolution between this filter and the argument data. The following combinations of size and boundary extensions are considered, with N = data.size() and K = halfImpulseResponse.length:
Extension (in)Size (in)Size (Filter)Extension (out)
ANTIMIRRORS_BETWEEN_SAMPLESN2 K + 1MIRRORS_BETWEEN_SAMPLES
ANTIMIRRORS_ON_SAMPLESN2 K + 1MIRRORS_ON_SAMPLES
ANTISYMMETRICN2 K + 1MIRRORS_ON_SAMPLES
MIRRORS_BETWEEN_SAMPLESN2 K + 1ANTIMIRRORS_BETWEEN_SAMPLES
MIRRORS_ON_SAMPLESN2 K + 1ANTIMIRRORS_ON_SAMPLES
PERIODICN2 K + 1PERIODIC
SPREAD_EXTREMAL_VALUES12 K + 1ANTIMIRRORS_ON_SAMPLES
All other combinations result in an exception of type IllegalArgumentException.
